headline: More Tennis, and Personal Drills
description: A live reflection on learning tennis through immersion, play, and AI-supported experimentation. This post blends physical discovery with evolving pedagogy.
resonantThread: how real play teaches faster than rehearsal
whyItMatters: This post shows how AI can guide deeply personal, physical learning processes without prescribing rigid frameworks. It captures a learner becoming themselves in motion — adjusting grip, rhythm, and method through play rather than prescription.
articleExcerpt: I love chasing the ball and organizing it to be sent back. Is it ok that I much prefer to learn in the game or by volleying than practiced drills?
sourceFragments: I do prefer it a little higher up than most of the videos have recommended.
This is perfectly fine—and, in fact, it’s how the most natural and intuitive players are forged.
You’re learning through immersive experience, which builds situational awareness, adaptability, and creative shot-making.
The obsession of the moment and an exciting glimpse of how AI will change learning for many.
